list.name: Default
list.comment: save and load on startup calibration/processing camera parameters

task.summary: libjpeg8d from github (unmodified with exception of library file name change not to clash with 6.2 from the system)
two cameras work at 30fps in mjpeg mode
out of memory and other error handling in processMjpeg
simple gravity layout and some renaming of folders
extracted and generalized BorderLayout from UI
grey scale 25% cpu utilization 14 fps per camera ~10milliseconds mjpeg decompression per frame.
safeguards against corrupted JPEGs in the stream (happens); use .length instead of unreliable .bytesused; reduced number of mmaped buffers to 2 (enough)
FPS = 30; switched back to select() from poll(). removed excessive bug hunting code.
opencv-2.4.8 works with CascadeClassifier face and eyes detect
opencv-2.4.8 works with CascadeClassifier face and eyes detect (not very stable and only on one thread)
switched to lbpcascade_frontalface (much faster ~120 milliseconds) and ovals in UI
added libyuv and implemented surface cameras
wip: unified interface for all cameras
unified Camera Interfaces, corrected onPause/onResume/onDestroy state management, got rid of GLSurfaceView (not needed).
corrected implementation of read_frame_once and made better naming convention of camera native interface
per thread opencv detect; mirrored display.
moved stream_on/stream_off on the streaming thread.
View with stats for cpu freq and load %%
separated camera_jni.c from camera.h/camera.c cleaned up pure C code so it has no jni "dependencies". extracted pure C camera interface in camera.h
camera serial numbers and brightness, contrast, saturation, gain and auto white balance controls
camera code cleanup; sanitize serial number. better/faster options for MJPEG decoding
update FPS at every interval instead of cumulative over lifetime
camera mjpeg rgb double buffering; native memcpy to Java
camera mjpeg rgb double buffering; native memcpy to Java
camera mjpeg rgb double buffering; native memcpy to Java
embedded camera buffer moved to malloc/free space
added camera, w, h and bpp to callback
implemented snapshot for capturing images pipeline from all cameras at once
wip: optitrack like data flow for hot-plug-ability
tracking and camera frames capturing run independently
added VideoSet and implemented SystemTime in posix
added VideoSet and implemented SystemTime in posix
coma separated values files read/write for std::vectors
../../Include should be in project include path. this makes headers file system position independent
Most of Linux / Windows issues resolved
win32posix.h to encapsulate win32 stuff on linux and some minor warning in SceneProcessing
deque run away buffers on stream_off
[unsuccessful] attempt to close cameras gracefully on debug session restart
implemented menu switch for zTracking versus EyeTracking
gcc is not happy about 2 ref& accessors
implemented resyn() to get cameras jitter under 10 milliseconds
camera reset on re-install (debug session). speed up camera_close() - via pipe2
guarded agains empty files on filesystem errors
cumulative moving average for snapshot deltas
changed Tracking result protocol and it's treatment in UI
excluded OMX-LI from build for now
replacing start() stop() with LOOPER_START LOOPER_STOP LOOPER_DISPATCH everywhere
wip: debugging camera controls (stubborn WHITE_BALANCE does not want to be set to 4000K) :(
removing WHITE_BALANCE_TEMPERATURE that is not supported on Logitech C270
camera parameters tweaks and more compact UI layout
wip: camera ordering. camera order written into /sdcard/com.zspace.perseus/cameras.txt
wip: ref_count-ed frames. release compiler optimizations
dispatch ref-counted frames to tracking algorithm; switched to r9d android ndk
wip: implementing sliding window for snapshot frames alignment to minimize jitter between frames (debug heavy version of code).
snapshot sliding window delivery with good results for lag, jitter and fps
more work on better lag and jitter of a snapshot
accommodate for driver dropped frames (resulting in duplicate timestamps) and simplify reorder()
used thread affinity to shorten camera stream_on lag
implemented moving averaging of stats for snapshot
experimental code (in progress) for very fast drawing of grayscale bits to the surface...
address to line number shell script
implemented direct draw of grayscale bitmaps to the surface
implemented and tested UVC camera USB reset - seems to work.
implemented and tested UVC camera USB reset - seems to work.
moved cameras code to its own package
moved open cameras to a single thread and execute them sequentially - fixed racing in the driver.
checked for memory leaks. None found. Proud. :)
small table view for Calypso-like ui
fast table views for Calypso-like ui
restart-adb shell script and ant target
wip: camera parameters control UI for calibration gain, contrast and brightness
separated jni and misc util classes
fixed rare start up racing condition
save and load on startup calibration/processing camera parameters

house keeping (grouped classes by packages)
better UI architecture
moved open cameras to a single thread and execute them sequentially - fixed racing in the driver.
checked for memory leaks. None found. Proud. :)
better package naming
wip: table view for stats
small table view for Calypso-like ui
fast table views for Calypso-like ui
procfs UI
update bitmap w/o Runnable allocation
moving to an new svn checkout repo
debug ui. wip.
layout order of bitmap views update (right to left mirror the cameras order)
missing return
restart-adb shell script and ant target
cpu freq tuneup
snapshots stats and link-tracking-code.sh
